summary: Congress funds efforts to bolster democracy abroad as a way to promote American values, national security, and economic opportunity. This has included work aimed at strengthening human rights, independent media, and the rule of law. The State Department and U.S. Agency for International Development allocated over $8.8 billion for democracy assistance in fiscal years 2015-2018. The agencies coordinate their efforts in various ways and have...
title: Democracy Assistance: State Should Improve Information Sharing with Embassies
